qas.question: What year did Victorias reputation begin to suffer?

qas.question: What was Queen Victoria called after Lady Flora's death due?

qas.question: What year did Victorias reputation begin to recover?
What was the job of sir Flora Hastings in Victorias household?
What health issue did Flora hastings develop that began to help Victorias reputation?
What wasn't Flora hastings abdominal growth rumored to be?
Who was rumored to be the mother of Flora Hastings "pregnancy"?

context: At the start of her reign Victoria was popular, but her reputation suffered in an <a0_0><b14_0>1839<b14_0/><a0_0/> court intrigue when <a1_0><a9_0><b15_0>one of her mother's ladies-in-waiting<b15_0/><a1_0/>, <a5_0>Lady Flora Hastings<a9_0/><a5_0/>, developed <a2_0><b16_0>an abdominal growth<b16_0/><a2_0/> that was widely rumoured to be <a3_0><b17_0>an out-of-wedlock pregnancy<b17_0/><a3_0/> by <a4_0><a10_0><b18_0>Sir John Conroy<b18_0/><a10_0/><a4_0/>. Victoria believed the rumours. She hated Conroy, and <a11_0>despised<a11_0/> "that odious Lady Flora", because she had conspired with <a7_0>Conroy and the Duchess of Kent<a7_0/> in <a12_0>the Kensington System<a12_0/>. At first, Lady Flora refused to submit to a naked medical examination, until in mid-February she eventually agreed, and was found to be a virgin. Conroy, the Hastings family and the opposition Tories organised a press campaign implicating the Queen in the spreading of false rumours about Lady Flora. When Lady Flora died in July, the post-mortem revealed a <a6_0><a13_0>large tumour on her liver<a6_0/> that had distended her abdomen<a13_0/>. At public appearances, Victoria was hissed and jeered as "<a8_0>Mrs. Melbourne<a8_0/>".
